踠踠踠

踠字的基本解释

踠
wǎn
骡马等脚与蹄相连接的弯曲处：“马有双脚胫，亭行六百里，迴毛起踠膝，是也。”
弯曲：“马踠足，是以不得速。”
病名，手脚弯曲不能伸直：“然得而腊之以为饵，可以已大风、挛、踠、瘘、疠。”

踠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wǎn］
［《廣韻》於阮切，上阮，影。］
(1)人体足胫相连的活动部位。
(2)指马脚与蹄间相连的屈曲处。
(3)弯曲。
[②]［wò］
［《集韻》烏卧切，去過，影。］
（手足等）猛折而筋骨受伤。

踠字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　踠； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1228第21
【廣韻】【正韻】於阮切【集韻】【韻會】委遠切，?音宛。體屈也。【玉篇】申脚也。【後漢·班固傳】馬踠餘足。【註】踠，猶屈也。　又【集韻】烏臥切，音涴。與踒同。【類篇】足跌也。

踠字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
踠字的起名意思

暂无。

To
Basic explanation of words
To
wǎn
The mule and horse wait for the bent place where the foot and the hoof are connected: "The horse has two shins, the pavilion walks six hundred miles, and the feathers are raised and knees, yes."
Bend: "Horse feet are not fast."
The name of the disease, the hands and feet cannot be straightened out: "However, it can be used as bait, and it can be caused by gale, contracture, fistula, and boil."
To
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wǎn］
["Guang Yun" Yu Ruan Qi, Shang Ruan, shadow. ]
(1) The movable part of the human foot and shin.
(2) Refers to the flexion between the horse's foot and the hoof.
(3) Bending.
[②]［wò］
["Ji Yun" Wu lying cut, I have been, shadow. ]
(Hands, feet, etc.) violently broken and injured bones and muscles.
To
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Youth Collection】【Foot Character Department】　踠; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1228-21
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Yu Ruan Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Wei Yuan Qi,? Yin Wan. Body bending also. [Jade articles] Shen feet also. [The Legend of the Later Han·Bangu] The horse has more than one foot. [Note] 踠, still bends.　 [Ji Yun] Wu lying and cutting, sound lingering. Same as Qu. 【Category】Footfall.
To

wǎn
гл. гнуться, сгибаться, подгибаться; подвёртываться, вывёртываться (о ноге)
马踠 у лошади подвернулись ноги
